properties.areaDesc: Wyoming Black Hills; Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 3 at 11:28AM MST until February 3 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Rapid City SD
properties.description:
A winter storm will continue to bring snow to portions of
northeastern Wyoming and southwestern South Dakota through this
evening. As the parent low pressure system shifts southeastward
later today, snow will gradually end from northwest to southeast.
Additional accumulations will be highest over southern portions
of northeastern Wyoming and far southwestern South Dakota, where
an additional 3 to 5 inches are likely. Elsewhere, scattered snow
showers are expected, but additional accumulations will be
limited to an inch or two.

* WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches.

* WHERE...In Wyoming, the Wyoming Black Hills. In South Dakota,
the Northern Black Hills and the Central Black Hills.

* WHEN...Until 6 PM MST this evening.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED
